subject: Medicine
title: The Four Principles
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Four Principles.

hook.text: Nearly every medical ethics dilemma can be analyzed through just four principles. They're deceptively simple.

buildup.text: Beauchamp and Childress defined four pillars: autonomy, beneficence, non-maleficence, and justice.

discovery.text: Autonomy respects patient choice. Beneficence does good. Non-maleficence avoids harm. Justice ensures fairness.

twist.text: The principles often conflict. Respecting a patient's autonomy might mean allowing them to refuse lifesaving treatment.

climax.text: Ethics isn't about finding the right answer‚Äîit's about weighing competing principles in impossible situations.

quiz.question: What are the four principles of medical ethics?
